greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let Cn(x) be the n-th cyclotomic polynomial; a(n) is the least k>1 such that Cn(k) is prime.
comment: Conjecture: a(n) is defined for all n. - _Eric Chen_, Nov 14 2014
Existence of a(n) is implied by Bunyakovsky's conjecture. - _Robert Israel_, Nov 13 2014
a(n) = A117544(n) except when n is a prime power, since if n is a prime power, then A117544(n) = 1. - _Eric Chen_, Nov 14 2014
link: Eric Chen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1500
example: a(11) = 5 because C11(k) is composite for k = 2, 3, 4 and prime for k = 5.
a(37) = 61 because C37(k) is composite for k = 2, 3, 4, ..., 60 and prime for k = 61.
maple: for k from 2 do if isprime(numtheory:-cyclotomic(n,k)) then return k fi od
mathematica: Table[k = 2; While[!PrimeQ[Cyclotomic[n, k]], k++]; k, {n, 300}] (* _Eric Chen_, Nov 14 2014 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = k=2; while(!isprime(polcyclo(n, k)), k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 13 2014
results.author: _Don Reble_, Jun 28 2003
